column1: The factor IX assay is a blood test that measures the activity of factor IX.
Or, it may be ordered if a family member is known to have hemophilia B.

Decreased factor IX activity may be related to: - Congenital deficiency of factor IX (hemophilia B) - Disorder in which the proteins that control blood clotting become over active (disseminated intravascular coagulation) - Fat malabsorption (not absorbing enough fat from your diet) - Liver disease (such as cirrhosis) - Vitamin K deficiency - Taking the blood thinning drug called warfarin (Coumadin)
